docs.lead_paragraph: Anthropologist and childbirth expert Sheila Kitzinger, whose books helped people around the world begin new lives as parents, has died. She was 86.

headline.main: Natural Childbirth Expert Sheila Kitzinger Dies at 86
headline.print_headline: Natural Childbirth Expert Sheila Kitzinger Dies at 86

docs.snippet: Anthropologist and childbirth expert Sheila Kitzinger, whose books helped people around the world begin new lives as parents, has died. She was 86.

docs.lead_paragraph: At 84, she sits comfortably as one of the greatest authors in American history, even as her uncompromising dream for black literature seems farther away than ever.

headline.main: The Radical Vision of Toni Morrison

docs.abstract: Profile of Toni Morrision, author and Nobel-laureate who at age 84 has released her latest novel God Help the Child; she explores her project of writing about African-American experience.
docs.snippet: At 84, she sits comfortably as one of the greatest authors in American history, even as her uncompromising dream for black literature seems farther away than ever.

docs.lead_paragraph: Swedish Match argues its product, Snus — moist ground tobacco in a sachet to be tucked between the lip and the gum — is far less harmful than cigarettes.

headline.main: Milder Warning Opposed for Swedish Tobacco Item
headline.print_headline: Milder Warning Opposed for Swedish Tobacco Item

docs.abstract: Panel of experts assembled by Food and Drug Admin rejects argument from company Swedish Match that its smokeless tobacco product Snus is far less harmful than cigarettes and should be labeled as a less dangerous; panel's recommendations are not binding but anti-smoking advocates speculate that, based on such findings, FDA would be unlikely to approve company's application.
docs.snippet: Swedish Match argues its product, Snus — moist ground tobacco in a sachet to be tucked between the lip and the gum — is far less harmful than cigarettes.

docs.lead_paragraph: Government advisers recommended against a proposal by Swedish Match to market its smokeless tobacco pouches as less harmful than cigarettes and other tobacco products.

headline.main: FDA Panel Opposes Dropping Warnings From Tobacco Pouch
headline.print_headline: FDA Panel Opposes Dropping Warnings From Tobacco Pouch

docs.snippet: Government advisers recommended against a proposal by Swedish Match to market its smokeless tobacco pouches as less harmful than cigarettes and other tobacco products.

docs.lead_paragraph: According to most female prisoners interviewed by a correctional group, New York State prison guards regularly violate department policy and state law on handling prisoners giving birth.

headline.main: Restraint of Pregnant Inmates Is Said to Persist in New York Despite Ban
headline.print_headline: A Banned Practice for Pregnant Inmates Is Said to Persist

docs.abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column notes accounts from women who gave birth while incarcerated in New York State claiming they were shackled during labor, despite 2009 ban on restraining inmate in labor; survey of 27 women reveals that 23 participants reported being restrained; accounts conflict with official records showing that women were not bound.
docs.snippet: According to most female prisoners interviewed by a correctional group, New York State prison guards regularly violate department policy and state law on handling prisoners giving birth.

docs.lead_paragraph: It became the first state to ban the safest method of ending a second-trimester pregnancy.

headline.main: Kansas Tries to Stamp Out Abortion
headline.print_headline: Kansas Tries to Stamp Out Abortion

docs.abstract: Editorial deplores decision by Kansas to ban abortion procedure known as dilation and evacuation, common and safe process for ending second-trimester pregnancy; criticizes ban as part of overarching effort to restrict women's reproductive freedom and to impose lawmakers' moral beliefs on decisions best left to doctor and patient.
docs.snippet: It became the first state to ban the safest method of ending a second-trimester pregnancy.

headline.main: Turning to Big, Big Data to See What Ails the World

docs.abstract: A new measurement system that includes disabilities from disease and disaster offers a surprising view of public health.
docs.snippet: A new measurement system that includes disabilities from disease and disaster offers a surprising view of public health.

docs.lead_paragraph: Veteran Taiwanese filmmaker Sylvia Chang is making a comeback after a seven-year hiatus with "Murmur of the Hearts," which pairs seasoned actors with fresh faces to tell a story about three young people with a broken past struggling with finding compassion in their relationships.

headline.main: Sylvia Chang Makes Comeback With 'Murmur of the Hearts'
headline.print_headline: Sylvia Chang Makes Comeback With 'Murmur of the Hearts'

docs.lead_paragraph: Indonesian prosecutors insisted Thursday they have shown enough evidence that an American couple deliberately plotted to kill the woman's mother while vacationing on Bali and should be found guilty of premeditated murder and sentenced to jail.

headline.main: Indonesian Prosecutors Insist Murder of US Woman Was Planned
headline.print_headline: Indonesian Prosecutors Insist Murder of US Woman Was Planned

docs.snippet: Indonesian prosecutors insisted Thursday they have shown enough evidence that an American couple deliberately plotted to kill the woman's mother while vacationing on Bali and should be found guilty of premeditated murder and sentenced to jail.

docs.lead_paragraph: What do we know about the latest Republican candidate for president?
docs.abstract: Gail Collins Op-Ed column assess political outlook for Sen Rand Paul in light of his announcement that he will seek Republican nomination for president in 2016; observes Paul has shifted his position on a number of issues in lead-up to bid; offers humorous quiz.
docs.snippet: What do we know about the latest Republican candidate for president?
